intro: Strychnos mueghe, commonly known as the African strychnos, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. It is also known for containing toxic alkaloids, such as strychnine, which can be harmful to humans and animals. Due to its toxicity, it is often avoided in traditional medicine unless used under strict supervision.
